14 foods you should eat to clean your arteries and keep them healthy

admin
4 months ago

The leading cause of death in the world, according to the World Health Organization (WHO), cardiovascular disease is a group of disorders affecting the heart and blood vessels. Several factors lead to the appearance of these, such as smoking, physical inactivity, diabetes or even hyperlipidemia. To guard against cardiovascular disease, it is essential to adopt a healthy lifestyle and to favor foods that improve the health of the arteries. Here are 15 foods to include in your diet to protect against cardiovascular disorders.

Heart attacks, strokes, atherosclerosis, all of which can be life-threatening. The E-Times tells us that to avoid them, it is essential to have a healthy lifestyle by promoting exercise and foods that clean the arteries. Did you know that sardines are good for cardiovascular health? If you read the following lines, you will know what you need to incorporate into your diet to protect your arteries.

1- Orange

Citrus is the ideal food for clearing arteries. It is full of pectins and thus blocks the absorption of bad cholesterol by the body. According to this study, frequent consumption of orange juice allows a considerable drop in the cholesterol present in the blood.

2- kale

Leafy vegetables are recommended for cleaning the arteries, especially kale. Rich in omega 3, antioxidants and fiber, this food should be preferred by people likely to develop arterial disorders.

3- Spinach

Rich in vitamin A and C, spinach is also a great source of beta carotene. According to this study, this food is very effective in combating the stiffness of the arteries.

4- pomegranate

This delicious fruit is effective in clearing the arteries. Rich in punic acid and antioxidants, it prevents plaque from forming inside the arteries. It’s scientifically proven: its consumption helps fight against all cardiovascular diseases.

5- Sesame seeds

These seeds are ideal for combating the development of atherosclerosis. According to this study, their antioxidant and anti-inflammatory power acts as a real shield for the cardiovascular system.

6- Garlic

Renowned for many virtues, garlic is also effective in reducing plaque and blood pressure. According to the researchers, the food is useful in reducing the effects of atherosclerosis.

7- Dark chocolate

Thanks to its richness in cocoa and flavonoids, dark chocolate helps make the arteries more flexible and thus prevent heart disease. A small square per day is advisable to enjoy its benefits on overall health.

8- Lemon

Thanks to its powerful antioxidant power, lemon is excellent for the health of the arteries and the heart. The citrus fruit is also rich in vitamin C, helping to reduce inflammation and lower the cholesterol level in the blood.

9- Turmeric

The golden spice is effective in fighting atherosclerosis and lowering cholesterol levels in the blood. Rich in polyphenols, it helps protect the arteries and more generally the cardiovascular system.

10- Sardines

Rich in omega 3 and fatty acids, sardines are the most recommended fish for heart health. They increase levels of good cholesterol as well as reduce inflammation. According to this study, sardines help protect cardiovascular health.

11- Lentils

Thanks to their richness in magnesium, potassium and proteins, lentils help to reduce the plaque present in the arteries. It’s scientifically proven: the consumption of these oilseeds is recommended for the heart.

12- Almond

Thanks to their antioxidant power, almonds are recommended for coronary health. According to the researchers, they lower the hyperlipidemia responsible for most cardiovascular diseases.

13- Watermelon

Rich in citrulline, an amino acid, watermelon helps to heal inflammation and cleanse the arteries. This fruit is also rich in nitric oxide, an element that reduces blood pressure.

14- Blueberries

Blueberries are prized for their antioxidant action. They reduce the plaque responsible for atherosclerosis and fight against free radicals responsible for cardiovascular disease.

Caution :
Before introducing these foods into your diet, it is essential to consult a specialist doctor.
